alert.note: Alert for Lancaster (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 17 at 11:43PM CDT until May 18 at 12:45AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: The National Weather Service in Omaha has issued a * Flood Advisory for... Central Lancaster County in southeastern Nebraska... * Until 345 AM CDT. * At 1142 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain that will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Up to two inches of rain have already fallen. * Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lincoln, Waverly, Lincoln Airport, Pioneers Park, Holmes Lake Park and Walton. Additional rainfall of one to two inches is possible over the area as additional storms form to the west. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. This includes Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 395 and 411.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. A Flood Advisory means river or stream flows are elevated, or ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
